name: gobble
content:
gobble verb
(EAT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] informal to eat food too fast: She gobbled her dinner (down/up).

to eat foodeatWhat do you want to eat for lunch?haveI'll just have one more piece of chocolate cake.consumeHe consumes vast quantities of bread with every meal.devourThe children devoured a whole packet of biscuits.bolt (down)Don't bolt down your food - you'll make yourself ill!gobble (up/down)The children gobbled their sweets.

gobble something up
gobble verb
(EAT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ] to eat quickly and sometimes with a lot of noise: [ M ] She gobbled up/down her lunch and hurried back.
gobble verb
(MAKE NOISE)
[ I ] to make the sound of a male turkey (= a large bird)
